title: "Malin + Goetz" handwritten script from Barney's
content:
Hi everybody,

I haven’t had any luck with getting this font ID’d at My Fonts’ “What the Font?” forum, so I thought I’d try here...

Is this a commercially available script font, or something that was drawn by hand and/or custom-made?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001451im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Malin+Goetz_5023.gif)

Any help will be greatly appreciated!

Cheers,  
John the Fontaholic

 [‹ (x) Tokyo Sushi lettering on wall - Albertus {Akira}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001451/http:/typophile.com/node/37792 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Action Time Vision condensed sans - Nimbus Cond {Florian} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001451/http:/typophile.com/node/37828 "Go to next forum topic")
author: John the Fontaholic

comments.content: Might be easier if you had a sample attached.

Didn’t work because of a space in the file name.  
Here it is:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001451im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Malin-Goetz_5023_3554.gif)

There are no repeating characters, so it’s hard to say definitively just by looking at it.

- Lex

I could upload a larger sample — I was restricted by My Fonts’ What the Font? forum only wanting an image with so many identifying thingys...

Cheers,  
John the Fontaholic

It looks like it’s used all over the [Barney’s website](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001451/http:/www.barneys.com/) (click a few links to see the categories in red). I’m sorry, but I don’t believe I’ve ever seen that font before.

For future reference, John, it’s the MyFonts automated WTF utility that has a max of 25 characters. For the MyFonts Forum, as here, more is generally better for identification purposes.

I see now that Jan was unable to ID your font on the MyFonts forum - and she is the _very best_ at script fonts. I also see that Metro2005 came up with the same conclusion I thought likely - that your font is a Barney’s exclusive.

I went through all 25 pages of [Part 11 of Mike Y’s Script ID Guide,](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001451/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script11Pg1.html) using the distinctive ’y’ to try to find this font. The only font with a similar ’y’ is Chas HW (which is otherwise not a match).

Based on the source, this is most likely a custom job for Barneys. You could try contacting someone at [Ingredient](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001451/http:/www.theingredient.com/) as they seem to have designed the site.

- Lex

Hi everyone,

Well thanks for your help in this request — it’s semi-comforting to know that if all the font gurus here are stumped, then at least I’m in good company! ;-)

Cheers,  
John the Fontaholic
